pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:5.1: 53. The training rule on reviling a group
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.2: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī started quarrels and disputes, and she created legal issues in the midst of the Order.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.3: But when a legal procedure was being done against her, the nun Thullanandā protested against it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.4: Soon afterwards Thullanandā went to a village on some business.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.6: took the opportunity to eject Caṇḍakāḷī for not seeing an offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.7: When Thullanandā had finished her business in that village, she returned to Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.8: Upon her return, Caṇḍakāḷī neither prepared a seat for her, nor set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, or water for washing,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.9: and she did not go out to meet her to take her bowl and robe and to ask whether she wanted anything to drink.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.11: why she was acting like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.13: She replied, “That is how it is, Venerable, when one is without a protector.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.14: “But how is it, Venerable, that you’re without a protector?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.16: that I was without a protector and that no-one would speak up for me because of my bad reputation, they ejected me for not seeing an offense.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:6.18: “They are incompetent fools. They don’t know about legal procedures, the flaws in such procedures, or what constitutes their failure or successful accomplishment.” And being angry she reviled the group.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:7.2: “How could Venerable Thullanandā revile a group in anger?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:7.3: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:7.6: How can the nun Thullanandā revile a group in anger?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:7.7: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:7.8: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:8.1: ‘If a nun reviles a group in anger, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:11.2: the Order of nuns is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:12.2: if she reviles them, saying, “They are incompetent fools. They don’t know about legal procedures, the flaws in such procedures, or what constitutes their failure or successful accomplishment,” she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:12.3: If she reviles several nuns, a single nun, or someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:13.2: if she is aiming at what is beneficial;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:13.3: if she is aiming at giving a teaching;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:13.4: if she is aiming at giving instruction;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc53:13.6: if she is the first offender.
